sentence.Network_en: The company was supposed to bivouac overnight and then return to the post the next day.
sentence.Network_cn: 预期这个连当天在野外露营,次日返回驻地.

sentence.Network_en: While in bivouac, we spent the night in our sleeping bags under the stars.
sentence.Network_cn: 在临时宿营地, 我们就头顶星星,躺在睡袋里过夜.

sentence.Network_en: In the world's broad field of battle, In the bivouac of Life.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这人生的宿营地, 在这辽阔的世界战场.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (denoting a night watch by the whole army): from French, probably from Swiss German Bîwacht 'additional guard at night', apparently denoting a citizens' patrol supporting the ordinary town watch

entry.tran: （士兵或登山者的）露营，临时宿营
entry.def: A bivouac is a temporary camp made by soldiers or mountain climbers.
If you bivouac in a particular place, you stop and stay in a bivouac there.

example.ex: We bivouacked on the outskirts of the city.

means.word_mean: 1. temporary living quarters specially built by the army for soldiers;

sentences.sentence: "wherever he went in the camp the men were grumbling"

means.word_mean: 2. a site where people on holiday can pitch a tent
1. live in or as if in a tent;

sentences.sentence: "Can we go camping again this summer?"
"The houseguests had to camp in the living room"

auth_sentence.content: Sometimes we lobbed apples at him from the crab-apple tree that sheltered our bivouac.

auth_sentence.content: He could bivouac upstairs, set out all his toilet articles in the guest bath.
